Reviews.Title: “How desperate are you to be near the Quarter?”
Reviews.Author: srouse1
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Hotel de L'Eau Vive. We had a two bedroom one bath suite accommodations. This hotel is straight out of the 1980's. It certainly has not been renovated since then (or so it seems). The bathroom had a huge built it jacuzzi tub which would had been nice except it has been patched up so often that pieces of the terrible patch job floated in the water every time the tub was used. The shower hardly worked up any water pressure so it was difficult to rinse. The carpet in the suite was lose in several places. Not only does this look bad, but it is an incredible hazard (and a liability for hotel management). We did have someone come in daily and make the beds, but that was the extent of the maid service. No real cleaning took place and no supplies were provided. In fact we ran out of toilet paper toward the end of the week, but we had brought our own and did not even bother to request any. Also, there was roof leak just outside our room, so they placed two trash cans to catch the water (very high class!!). The worse part of this though, was that the leak had obviously we the carpet leaving a mildew smell every time we walked into our suite. Finally, there is no parking at the hotel. We were not offered a good option by the hotel staff other than the public lots a few blocks away or the Casino parking (Harrah's) which is $30.00 a night unless you gamble for 30 minutes (which may be free or much more expensive depending on your luck). In sum, I don't have a lot of positive things to say about this hotel. I think the price is hefty for what it offers. I realize that location is everything, but for the same or similar price you can find much nicer accommodations a mile or so a way. It is totally worth it to give up the short distance for a much better set-up. As one might guess, I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel... Near all the Sights...”
Reviews.Author: NCPirate
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in Hotel de L'eau Vive. We were in a three room suite in the annex next to the main hotel. The rooms were clean and had everything we needed to relax while we explored in and around New Orleans. Each bedroom, and the living room, had flat screen TVs. The master bedroom had a king bed...the other two had queens. The second bedroom had no closet or windows...but was very quiet. The third had a closet and window...though you only got light and no views. The master bedroom had a nice closet, a bathroom and a window from which you had views of Tchoupitoulas Street. The drawback was that it was easy to hear the noise from below. We conquered the noise by having the fan run continuously at night. The bedroom TVs were very small...had trouble seeing the channel numbers...but they did work well. .....The kitchen was fully equipped with appliances, but was short on some of the cooking utensils. There were plenty of glasses and plates. .....The chairs/couches were comfortable and there was a dining table with chairs. There is an elevator and fire stairs...if you need the exercise. The WiFi was hit and miss...missed most of the week. We could go to the coffee room (they call it the reading room) in the main building and get Internet access at any time. There was coffee and copies of the local newspaper each morning in the reading room, and pastries on Sat-Mon mornings. We had maid service each day. She made our beds, took out the trash, brought us fresh towels when requested, and tidied up every morning...which was excellent!! In the main hotel there is a washer and dryer...$1 in quarters per wash load...and $1 in quarters per dryer load...however, I was able to dry two loads on the first $1. This is one thing I wished they had available in the annex too! They have a very small swimming pool behind the main building...excellent for sitting in to cool off, but not large enough to swim in. There is a outside terrace on the top floor of the main building. On the location... It is perfect!! You are about 100 yds from the trolly stops. We enjoyed riding the air-conditioned often during our stay...we bought a three day pass for the first part of our stay and then one more day late in the week. We found we could easily walk to and from the French Quarter from our hotel, and considering the quality of the food in the many nearby restaurants, walking did us good. the WWII and Civil War museums were about four walking blocks away. We drove in and had to park our vehicle. This was our greatest concern...since the hotel has no parking and the nearby options were $25 dollars per day. There were $15 per day options, but the were a ways off and not very secure. The hotel did offer...and we took it...to give us a card to access a nearby secure parking deck at $20 per day. The advantage was that we could enter and level the parking deck as often as we liked. It was a short walk from the hotel. As for the staff at the hotel, they were very friendly and willing to help us with all our needs and questions. All in all, we found the site to be a very good place to stay and will certainly stay here again the next time we visit New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bking00
Reviews.Content: Like many of the other reviewers I was a little hesitant about staying here because of the mixed reviews but decided to take a chance because the price was right. It's not perfect but it is not awful, filthy or any of the other terrible things that have been posted. It is a very old building, it's New Orleans folks and it could certainly use some updating but all in all our stay was fine. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, 302, and it hasn't been totally updated but it was clean, the beds are comfortable and the furniture is not bad. I love the exposed brick and the big windows in the living area and the front bedroom. I wish the larger bed had been in the front room but I understand the back bedroom is considered the master because of the location to the bathroom. The weirdest part of the entire unit is the spa tub but again, it wasn't bad. The pool area is small but the pool was clean although I didn't have a chance to use it. The rooftop "terrace" needs work and UMBRELLAS, it's unbearably hot up there without some shade. The lack of parking is a bit inconvenient but there are plenty of lots within walking distance so again, it's not terrible. This property is typical of a lot of places in New Orleans, it has a lot of character but if you want shiny, new then stay in Metaire (which isn't New Orleans at all) or one of the high rise hotels on Canal Blvd. And as for the reviewer who flipped out over a roach...again, this is New Orleans, it's below sea level folks, it's the norm and that doesn't mean a place is filthy. Everyone at the property was very nice and helpful and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for an Urban Setting”
Reviews.Author: OlderCodger
Reviews.Content: We too stayed in the Pandora room. We stayed starting Friday, June 1, 2012. We were concerned given all the negative reviews, but found it clean and quite acceptable. We also noticed work being done throughout the hotel to upgrade its appearance. The superb: Location. Right by Harrahs and the French Quarter. Easy walking to sites, even in the heat and humidity. Who could ask for anything more? Also, the staff. Very attentive and easy to work with. The great: the kitchen, was in very good shape. We didn't use the oven or stove top but they appeared in good shape and relatively new. The coffee pot and microwave worked quite well. The kitchen had just about everything you could want to cook with. The good: The furnishings were well kept but are starting to show some wear and tear. I'd expect the carpet to be replace in a year or so. However, it was clean and suitable, as were the chairs and sofa. The average or less: The wifi was intermittent in the room. They kept telling us the connection was good in the lobby, but we prefer crawling out of bed, drinking coffee, and using the internet in the room to get it over and done with. Also, we exchanged into the hotel but still got a discount on a second room for friends of ours. They were in the Atlas room and found it as nice as we found ours. We really enjoyed the Hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Building”
Reviews.Author: kittens9
Reviews.Content: If you are into cookie cutter hotels, this is not the place for you. However, history buffs will love this place. It is like stepping back in time. All wood and interior old brick surfaces but yet has everything you need. Has a full kitchen and an excellenct location. Almost across the street from the Casino. You can park for free at the Casino if you play the slots for 30 min. each day. Has a really huge hot tub bath. Only problem we had was the bathroom knob was off but the door still opened and closed. Comfortable beds. As you can expect from an older building, it could have used a little updating but loved the atmosphere in the place. AC waas really cold and felt great after the 98 degree weather

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans stay April 2012”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGirlOhio
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat worried about checking in after the (mostly all) bad reviews we read about this place. Upon arrival we were greeted very warmly and check in took only minutes. We were in room 604B and I must say we were surprised when we opened the door. The room looked new-new furniture, carpet & kitchen area, bathroom, etc.! It was very clean and had everything we needed & enough room for two people for a 7 day stay. We were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed our stay in this lovely room. There are no windows in the room so if that's a problem for you-you may have to ask for a different room. I originally wanted a 1 bedroom unit but am SO glad they only had an efficiency suite (which includes a kitchen-fridge, stove microwave, table) available for our dates, it seems the 1 & 2 bedroom units are NOT remodeled and are not in the same condition as these new suites. We had a great time in the are-we felt safe and we were close to alot of attractions & restaurants (of all types) that we could walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Filithy and Dirty Dump”
Reviews.Author: Donald D
Reviews.Content: I've had a time share for over 20 years at this hotel. My daughters checked in on Sat. Water was coming out of the bathroom ceiling. They were told it couldn't be fixed until Monday. They were offered 2 other rooms, the first, the main door could be opened by shaking the door, the 2nd, when they pulled back the bed covers had several different color hairs in it. They left and went to the hotel across the street. This is how an original owner is treated.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: txwendyanne
Reviews.Content: The only shining light of our stay here was the staff. I think they felt sorry for us because the hotel is so filthy & in disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “Not much of a resort”
Reviews.Author: Mary L
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about this hotel is the location is good and the staff is friendly. The accommodations are a bit disappointing especially for a "resort". We traded our Williamsburg timeshare for this New Orleans hotel. Interval should be ashamed of themselves to include this run down property in their portfolio of resorts. The hotel is old and in need of modernization. The bathroom was not clean when we walked in and the paint in the jacuzzi area was peeling.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Meredith B
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this place I was a little worried before coming here. Although not the newest place in town, the place had character. This wasn't one of the huge hotel chains with tiny rooms and paper thin walls which was so nice. We stayed in room 106 ( right by the courtyard) and loved the place. It was a huge loft type room with TONS of room. The only downside was probably that there was only one bathroom and there were lots of steep ( spiral) steps to get to the bedrooms and bathroom. Other than that the staff was decent although the maid did seem to miss our room a couple days we did have plenty of fresh towels! GREAT location for walking everywhere and where our room was you couldn't hear any traffic. If I went to New Orleans again I would stay in this place again handsdown/

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Douglas55
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New Orleans, we stayed a week and I thought I would write a review. I always read the reviews before I stay anywhere. This is a older hotel, The only thing that really needs to be done with these rooms is a fresh coat of paint and the bathrooms updated. Next time I go back to New Orleans I will be staying there. The staff is great and Gale went above and beyond to make our stay there wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Needs serious work”
Reviews.Author: kuzmatic13
Reviews.Content: Elevetor did not work all week. Entire room is a trip back to 1980, needs to be remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Sacre Bleu”
Reviews.Author: Wendymath
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare week for a week in New Orleans, but this hotel was not our first choice. I would go back ONLY if itâ€™s my only choice. On the plus side, it is in a good location just on the edge of the French Quarter. It is easy to walk everywhere, and it is close to streetcar stops. The rooms are large and clean for the most part. The people at the desk were helpful and friendly enough. However, thatâ€™s where the good ends. Our room on the ground floor looked like a college apartment decorated with yard sale finds. The sofa was lumpy and the springs in the wing chair were totally shot. None of the artwork was coordinated. The bedspread was old and had cigarette burns. The bathroom door did not close fully. But the tub, well, words fail me. Supposedly itâ€™s a Jacuzzi, but it looks like a pool for baptisms. Itâ€™s been a year since we stayed there, so hopefully the room has been remodeled. (In order to post, I had to select a date from a drop down menu. We stayed here March 2010, not 2011.)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hidden Secret in the French Quarters!”
Reviews.Author: jvfloyd07
Reviews.Content: The staff is awesome at this location. You must visit them. The location is around the corner from the Casino and next to many eating places All walking distance of the hotel, and also to the Louisiana Superdome. We own 2 timeshares here, we love it that much and always tell all of our friends. Not one of them have been disappointed! Try it you will like it!

Reviews.Title: “yearly stay, we love it”
Reviews.Author: PBCartwright
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Hotel De L'eau Vive for many years, first as guests, now as time-share owners. We absolutely love it. It may be an old building, but it has class ! The Hotel staff is friendly, helpful, and it is nice to see the same faces year-after-year. The location is wonderful! You are 1 block from Harrah's, 1 block from Canal St & the French Quarter, and a few blocks from St. Charles & the street car line. We will be back this October, we can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: CuriousJanet
Reviews.Content: I must say, after reading the reviews I wanted to cancel my stay. I'm glad that I did not The staff were excellent and the room was awesome! The only thing that I would mention as a negative is that the ledges were a little dusty. This was my second trip back to Nawlins but first time at this hotel. I'm very selective and would found another place to stay if had been as bad as the reviews. Thanks Hotel De L'Eau Vivie for making my sons 32nd birthday a blast. Would definately stay here agian!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY....ALREADY RESERVED ROOM FOR NEXT YEAR!”
Reviews.Author: jblamar1
Reviews.Content: Me and four of my buddies stayed here during the 4th of July weekend. First of all, let me say that you can only check it out for yourself. We loved the room! We stayed in the 2BR 2BA penthouse suite, with our own rooftop terrace. Plenty of room, room was clean, and hotel staff was very friendly. We have stayed in New Orleans many times, but now we will be staying here every time!

Reviews.Title: “Historical significance doesn't out weigh proper maintenance and upkeep.”
Reviews.Author: cjmcfarland
Reviews.Content: We loved the location and close proximity to the Riverfront, Aquarium, Harrah's and Insectarium. Nice walk to Jackson Square, Bourbon Street and the French Market. The living area in suite 102 was very spacious although the sleeper sofa was broken. The kitchen was tight with only a mini fridge that door had to be shut just right to seal. The bedroom was very small without it's own TV and the air conditioning unit cycled on and off continually. The bathroom is what needs the most attention. Although the 'Roman' tub and domed ceiling are very interesting, it is in desperate need of updating and repair. Half painted faucet, 2 tone walls and slightly dangerous step in. There is no way my 89 year old grandmother could bathe. My suggestion is to also remove all the carpet because the humidity makes everything feel so damp. The pool is teeny tiny so not very exciting for young children or more than 2 adults at one time. We exchanged through Interval International and it is no where near the quality of other resorts that we have stayed in. I would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Your in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Fiebs
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at this time share and we visit every October. We are now in the new building since the old burned down after Hurricane Katrina. We stayed the first year it opened and were also a little disappointed that it had lost a lot of it's charm of the old building but we now have a balcony to sit on (yes there are no chairs, we bring our own with us) and everything is clean and new. Two bedrooms with two bathrooms; jetted tub; flat screen tv in every room and maid service when you want it (you just have to ask) I imagine that a lot of the people who complain about this hotel have never stayed anywhere else in New Orleans. I can assure you unless you are staying at the Ritz or the W every hotel in New Oleans has an older feeling to it, especially if you are in the Quarter. That is a part of the charm of New Orleans! We love our time share and feel we are in an excellent area for the quarter and the warehouse district and never need a car the whole week we are there. Come on....we are right behind Harrahs and right next to Mothers and have one of the best staff in New Orleans who bend over backward to make you comfortable, what more could you ask for? And besides....."Your in New Orleans" how much time do you spend in your room anway?

Reviews.Title: “We either had a great room or there are some super picky reviewers”
Reviews.Author: lbbs09
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 Bedroom/1 Bath suite in order to attend a conference in New Orleans. I stayed with 4 friends and the trip was part business/part leisure. Since my friends and I are young professionals we were on a tight budget and I researched a lot of places to stay. Hotel de L'Eau Vive came up the winner based on size, price and location. Suffice to say, I felt like we were throwing the dice on the booking based on the reviews the hotel received on this website. I did a lot of lowering of expectations for my travel party (i.e. we'll only be there to sleep! Expect old furniture! Please don't hate me if it stinks!) Boy was I surprised when we saw our room! It was fantastic. Everyone was impressed. We had a room in the main building. The place was clean, it was big and it had everything that we needed. But then again, we weren't expecting: 1) a Hilton, 2) a concierge or 3) lots of extras that you expect when you go with a chain or more modern hotel. The front desk people were friendly and helpful. The cleaning service came 2 out of 3 days, but we did not need service all 3 days, so we weren't bothered by it. My only complaint is that the front door to the hotel is unlocked after hours and there's no entry control system or security guard. Your room obviously is locked and has controlled access (and we didn't experience any problems with the front door while there), but it was a surprise when we discovered it. Location can't be beat! I would recommend booking in advance and asking for the best room available. And be nice, for goodness sake.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, all in all...”
Reviews.Author: Islandsue
Reviews.Content: Since I researched a lot prior to this trip, I was well prepared for the negative aspects of this hotel. We exchanged our Vegas timeshare for a week in The Big Easy. Our Vegas unit is only a one bedroom/one bath, but we lucked out in getting a three bedroom/two bath in New Orlenas. This worked out well, as we were a party of four. Front desk, housekeepers, and bellman all very friendly and helpful. Check in was a breeze. "Nate" helped us to our room located in the 'newer' section of the hotel. I was a bit disappointed because it lacks the charm of the main building, but all in all it worked out fine for us. The kitchen worked well for us. We cooked several meals for breakfast and the only thing missing from the kitchen was a cookie sheet, but we made do. Very nice large kitchen table with six chairs, and very large living room with a flat screen tv on the wall. The bedroom facing the street looked to be the largest, with a bathroom inside. The other two rooms shared a small bathroom. The middle room did not have any windows which our 20 yr old daughter loved. Since the rooms are small, this particular unit placed the dressers in the living/dining room. Sounds strange, and it was, but we had a possitive attitude and it really was not a problem. I asked to see a room in the main building, for the sake of comparison, and I would definately ask to be in one of those room next time. Lots of charm and just a good vibe. Since it was a little on the cold side while we visited, we did not use the swimming pool. Be aware, it is more like a splash pool. Nice little courtyard. Can't fit many people, so not sure how this works during the hot months. The location of this hotel worked well for us. It would have been better to be closer in the French Quarter, but we did not mind walking. I might try out another place closer in next trip. Harrah's is very close, as is the river and the streetcar. Canel Street is a short walk from the hotel, as is "Mother's" Restaurant. While this establishment does not get good reviews on this forum, we were surprised at how much we enjoyed the food and it is SO close to the hotel, which made it very convenient for us when we were either too tired to walk further, or it was too late to order elsewhere. Realize that New Orleans is a very old city and most of the building are also very old. Expect that. Yes, a few hotels are new(er) and you might enjoy that kind of establishment over the older ones. We have stayed at many timeshare resorts and most have been quite nice. The Hotel de L'Eau Vive is not a 4 or 5 star resort. If you accept that going into it, you won't be disappointed. No restaurant on site. No internet service (except in their smally lobby), and no fitness center. The only issue I had was the lack of hot water. We were able to work it out by scheduling when we took our daily showers, but you really should not have to do that. Not sure what the problem is, but the hot water ran out soon into a shower every singe time. Bummer, for sure. Other than that, I would recommend staying at this hotel. For the cost of an exchange ($140), it's worth a weeks stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely "Old New Orleans" experience”
Reviews.Author: Osprey72
Reviews.Content: We went here to visit our daughter and our son-in-law who just moved to New Orleans in July and to meet up with our other children who were here for the LSU-FLA football game. The hotel was very comfortable and quaint. It had all the amenities we needed and was very quiet. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There is no parking at the hotel but there is on- street parking which was not hard to find. It was very convenient to the French Quarters, good restaurants the RiverWalk which were all within walking distance. We would definitely stay here again. This was a timeshare. The only drawback was that it only had one bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “give it a try ,not perfect but positives location and staff”
Reviews.Author: spinneySouthampton
Reviews.Content: we stayed there september 2009 ,yes the previous comments about the poor state of the communal areas is true ,shabby paint work and carpets that could do with a clean or complete renew.The apartment we stayed in was of an ok standard some areas were poorly finished but was clean ,maid service each day change of towels etc.. The room location and access from the corridor would be no good to any one with mobility problems I.e from the lift you had to do 2 fire doors go down 2 stairs up 2 stairs a bit of an obstable course not easy with full cases. The big bonus with this hotel was its location 5 mins from Bourbon Street ,french quater etc,5 mins from river front ,Trams for canal street ,charles street out to the american district ,river front very close. Reception/frontdesk staff very good couldnt be mor helpful So if your fit and want to be out seeing the town night and day taking tours out to plantations ,paddle steamer down the missisipi ,ferry over to algiers its all to hand here with no extra transort costs this is an excellent base

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Disappointment EVER......”
Reviews.Author: cyncyn28
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin! I was going to post my review immediately when I got home but decided to wait a week so it wouldn't seem so harsh. I will start off with the positive. The staff was WONDERFUL. Everyone was very friendly, helpful and kind. They were definitely the bright spot during our stay. Now for the bad. We swapped for this timeshare through Interval International. They should be ashamed for even having this place listed. It was by no means a 4 or 5 star resort. We had a 2 bedroom 1 bath suite on the 3rd floor. The "elevator" was a joke! Only one person and their luggage could fit in the elevator at one time, which operated on a pully. I opted for the unsafe, metal, spiral staircase everyday, which was pitch black in the evening because the lights were out. When we asked them to fix it, they only put one bulb there. The pool was more like a bathtub. It was situated in a tiny courtyard that was rat infested! We had to pass through the pool area to get to the room and saw Mickey and his family on a regular basis! We were told that was common because of the sewers and pipes. When asked for clean blankets we were told the board only allows them to wash the blankets twice a month unless there are visable stains!!! When asked for someone to clean the bathroom, the reply was we don't do that - Only when guest leave! They did however give us the cleaning supllies to use ourselves. This place is in desperate need of repair and updating. Disgusting carpet, dark lighting and very old fixtures through out. There was one 19 inch tv for the entire 2 bedroom suite. We were handed the remote at check in. All the windows in our suite looked out to a view of a brick wall. There is so much more but I'm at my limit and can't write much more. I absolutely would not stay here EVER again.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: RaleighHunts
Reviews.Content: Our first time to New Orleans was made great in part to our hotel. It is what we needed for a week sans kids or car. Our room was on the first floor in the front of the building. It was a little noisey but only in the living room. The bedroom was a comfortable cave. There was only 1 TV and that was in the living room. It only had basic cable so no big deal. iThe bath tub was almost ridiculously mammoth sized.Great stocked kitchen with necessary utensils and flatware. My only complaint there was the useless freezer compartment. We didn realize it until we tookout soup made ice cream. It was adequate for a busy tourist couple. It was in a perfect location for visiting. It was far enough from the action but close enough to walk. It took a quick 2 minute walk to the harbor. Maybe 5 minutes to walk to the French Quater and just a little further for Burbon street which I dont recommend for families. Thats my biggest disappointment about New Orleans- not really anything to do about this hotel. New orleans is very beautiful but I didnt get a family vibe to it. No supermarkets, a lot of bars, not enough child friendly spaces, and too much walking for children. We'll go again but probably wont ever take our small children. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is just looking for a decent place to stay and doesnt need the frills of other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of charm & great location, but no amenities.”
Reviews.Author: morganatravels
Reviews.Content: First the disclosure - this is a timeshare & I am an owner. I had stayed in this locale several times & when a unit appeared on the market the spouse & i grabbed it.Stayed in December 2008 - first time back as an owner. Stayed with my spouse & elderly mother. We were there a week. There is a "refreshing pool" that is a pleasant place to sit & enjoy a cool refreshing beverage (that you brought outside with you!). We stayed in a 2 bedroom 1 bath unit. The bath is a garden tub for 4 and the shower is inside the tub. This WOULD NOT be easy for someone with limited mobility to access. There are handicap accessible units available though. The two bedrooms each had a queen size bed & chest of drawers. There is a huge common closet near the bathroom for hanging clothing & a large vanity outside the bathroom for makeup, hairdrying etc. The layout of the unit is somewhat circular so the bedrooms are well seperated. The kitchen, dining & living room is an open area and the sofa pulls out to a bed. The bedding was comfortable in all 3 places. Unlike most timeshares this is cleaned on a daily basis. Plenty of towels, extra blankets available etc. The staff has always been more than willing to help & this trip was no different. While it was quiet one afternoon I asked to be shown one of the newly remodeled suites. MY preference will be the older units that have brick walls, and a handful of oddities, but for those who prefer new & pristine - these are sweeeeeet! Very modern, new lcd tv, king bed etc. There isn't a restaurant on premises, but within a quick walk there are several options. Also there is a grocery that will deliver. We kept snacks in the room, but with all the wonderful restaurants in New Orleans it was so hard to think about skipping that aspect!!! Now onto the important stuff - the hotel is close to Harrah's (walk down the alley & you are there), 2 blocks from Canal Street, 1/2 mile from Bourbon St, near the Aquarium, the Convention Center. Name your desire & you are probably close to it. We flew in & once at the hotel walked or took the streetcars. All 3 lines have pick up points within a few blocks of the hotel. Absolutely great location, away from the madness of Bourbon St, but easy to walk to when you're in the mood !! Love the town & the location so much we'll be there for a long weekend in May!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Great Staff, But Can't Recommend This Timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: Babysis727
Reviews.Content: The location is great because youâ€™re a few blocks from the French Quarter, RiverWalk, and Harrahâ€™s!! We had 6 women in the 3 bedroom timeshare, with some of us staying for the entire week. Most of the staff was very enthusiastic, competent, accommodating and super nice! There were a few exceptions to this, including the cleaning staff. While daily cleaning services were provided, the cleaning was very superficial. We were pretty clean, but with this many people, the floors and bathrooms needed cleaning. A poor job was done when vacuuming and cleaning the tile floors. Overall we had adequate space and the layout of the timeshare was ok, but could have been better. We stayed in the annex building, which was recently rebuilt. The first impression when entering the foyer of the building turns you off because it is plain and dreary. It didnâ€™t seem new because the walls were dirty in the hallway and in our unit . The unit wasnâ€™t being well maintained and had spots on the carpet. The master bath tiles had mold/mildew. The master bathtub had a crack in it. There were holes in some of the blankets and towels (not plush). The furniture was nice, but the unit needs better and more artwork. Signs of poor construction or design: â€¢ Dishwasher door doesnâ€™t open all the way without hitting the refrigerator. This stopped the bottom dishwasher tray from being pulled out, which made it difficult to load items in the bottom half of the dishwasher. â€¢ The kitchen is small but there is extra open space at the front door. â€¢ Counter space in bathrooms was too small. There was room between the end of the counter and the wall to have extended the counter space. â€¢ Tiles in the master bathroom were crooked. â€¢ Beds only had 18â€� between the foot of the bed and the wall. â€¢ 1 bedroom had no closet. 2 of the bedrooms had the chest of drawers in the living area. I think was designed this way for people that slept on pull out sofas. It would be better to have only one these chests in the living space. â€¢ Flat screen tvs are mounted on the wall, which is great. However, the black cords trailing down the walls look tacky.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: friendsinpa
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. After reading some very negative reviews, we were apprehensive. The suite was clean, with new furniture, carpet and fresh paint. The original brick and terracotta tiles added charm. The two bedroom suite had a full living room, bath and kitchen. We were able to walk to all of our destinations. The staff was friendly, and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and we are looking forward to going back in the future. friends in pennsylvania

Reviews.Title: “In major need of upgrades”
Reviews.Author: helene_2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a trip to Hotel de L'Eau Vive. A quick review of the positives: friendly front desk staff who were very helpful; close to the French Quarter; Canal Street mall, Harrah's, Riverfront - we walked everywhere (don't bother renting a car - parking is very expensive). Negatives: The bathroom was in major need of upgrades. There is a huge jacuzzi (which sounds great) but not only is the shower located within the jacuzzi, but the surrounding concrete was cracked and moldy. The hotel elevator also could use a tune-up - every time we were in it we joked that we were in the Bates Motel. This place has a huge amount of potential - the units have brick walls and there's a lot of character. We spent very little time in our room - basically was just a place to sleep and shower, so it suited our needs, but if you're used to finer things, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a flash!”
Reviews.Author: DeeNKen
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare thru Interval International (II) based on II's website info on this hotel. We were very apprehensive after reading the initial reviews on TripAdvisor and happy to see some subsequent positive reviews before our trip. I e-mailed the hotel a week before our arrival to confirm our reservations and got an immediate e-mail confirmation reply from Fanci! We were greeted warmly when we checked in and received excellent, friendly service from all the staff we came in contact with, ie: restaurant recommendations, tour arrangements, calling cabs, etc. Our accomodations were great = very clean and had everything we could possibly need. Comfortable furnishings and great TV reception. Our bed was made daily, clean towels, trash emptied, etc.....not the 'once a week' routine usually associated with a timeshare, but daily service! If I HAD to say something negative, it would be that WiFi connections were sketchy....NOT a big deal! We had a great time and would stay at this hotel again in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Old New Orleans Charm, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bernicone
Reviews.Content: I don't know what's with the negative reviews, this is an old building with "Old New Orleans Charm" and the convenience of being located within walking distance or trolley ride of a week plus of activities. They must have been written by people with limited traveling experience. I try to get there at least every other year and never have been there when the elevator did not work. Whenever anything has not been right, it was fixed in an acceptable time. It is close to the French Quarter, without the noise, Riverwalk, Harrah's Casino, I-Max, Aquarium and more. It's a good example of what is said to be important: location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Not Reply So Please Be Aware”
Reviews.Author: RyKem
Reviews.Content: After finding this 5 Star Hotel for a timeshare exchange, I read the reviews on Tripadvisor.com. I was concerned as most of the reviews were negative so I called the hotel directly and asked for the manager. I was told there was no manager on duty at this time so I asked the person for their opinion of the reviews on tripadvisor.com. The reply was "some people like it and some do not." Please tell me something I would not have guessed! I sent a e-mal to the hotel's website asking for them to call me so we could discuss their reviews and asked for pictures of the hotel and rooms that were taken in 2008. Since I received neither an e-mail or phone call, I would suggest that the buyer be ware and give more weight to the negative reviews. Will let you know what I think about this hotel after our October visit. I have booked another hotel but want to see this hotel for myself.

Reviews.Title: “Happily Surprised”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesMike
Reviews.Content: We did a timeshare exchange. I read some reviews after we made the exchange and was very apprehensive about the trip. We had very low expectations about the hotel when we got there. The building exterior was not at all impressive, but the rooms were just great. We were pleasantly suprised by the size, cleanliness, and location. The staff were all pleasant and warm and helpfull, from the front desk to the housekeeping service. Everything was in working order except the telephone. Everyone has cell phones anyway. We were within a couple blocks of the casino, great restaurants, the French Quarter, and the streetcar. We each got a three day streetcar and bus tourpass for $12. Since we were so close to everything our cab rides were very inexpensive. I would do the whole thing again. Were we Lucky?

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but a big disappointing - zero stars!”
Reviews.Author: UncleGoofy
Reviews.Content: I'm appalled that Interval International would include this hotel at all. It is not a gem, it is old, run down and sad. The Elevator worked only 3 of the 7 days were were there. The air conditioning failed three nights, leaving us sweating profusely in our beds, and the staff (generally one person at the desk) couldn't help. One morning, at 9:00 AM, they turned the water off for "maintenance" and it was off for 2 hours! The "jacuzzi" tub was a joke. It was huge, large enough for 4 people but becasue of this it made showering next to impossible. One night it rained. The "Hotel" has 6 floors, and we were on the third, even on the thrid floor, the ceiling leaked while it was raining! The pictures on this hotels web site are not representative of the hotel. It looks NOTHING like the photos. I would not stay here again, nor recommend this hotel to anyone. There are awards on the wall near the elevator from 1988, maybe then it was nice, but not now!

Reviews.Title: “Bad is Still Bad even if you Lie!”
Reviews.Author: jga1011
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the photo's you see in this Hotel's web site. This place is less than a one star. Mislead and lied to. Interval sould be ashamed for offering this place!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to send someone you don't like”
Reviews.Author: Chadwick64
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through Interval International, and it was given a 5 Star Rating, but itâ€™s beyond me how! The staff at the hotel were as nice as could be, but the facility overall was a disaster! I understand that the building itself is old, and admit that itâ€™s age and history lends a certain charm to the facility. It also, to an extent, accounts for the cramped common areas, but not for the worn carpet and overall castaway feel of the furnishings in them. The entryway has a ramp for wheelchairs and right next to it two steps with no banister on either side. One misstep and I landed at the bottom, with gratefully nothing more than a sore wrist; I wonder how many other people have done the same. Our apartment was like going into a cave with the only natural light coming from a narrow skylight three stories up and sizeable gap under the front door. Again, the age of the facility and its restrictions are understandable; however, I donâ€™t think there was one 100 watt bulb in the unit which made reading difficult, and wasnâ€™t a pleasant experience overall. On our first day there, I requested that someone come in and fix the kitchen faucet before it fell off (the entire faucet and handle moved whenever the water was turned on), and it was never fixed. I hope they have insurance when that thing finally goes! The oven didnâ€™t open properly, or more precisely it couldnâ€™t because the refrigerator was in the way! I guess thatâ€™s why there was not one thing that could be used as bakeware available. The carpet was stained and filthy, as evidenced by white socks that may never recover. The cover on the ironing board was so past its prime that the big scorch mark on it completed its disgusting look! Needless to say, it went unused! The patio area around the pool was swept, but needed a good scrubbing, and flooded considerably when it rained (no drains) and it was our only way in and out. Having to leapfrog around a flooded patio and the pool in a vain attempt to get out with dry feet was both absurd and potentially dangerous. Overall, we would rate Hotel De L Eau Vive 2 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: MichaelR86
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with another couple stayed in a two bedroom/one bath for 6 nights. This was our first trip to New Orleans. If you're looking for super luxury, like the Ritz or Four Seasons, this is not the place. However, the staff was friendly and helpful throughout. The suite we were in was quite unique: The living room/kitchen/dining area was on the ground level and the bedrooms and bath were on three other levels above. If stairs are a problem, this would not be good for you. There was lots of exposed brick and the total area was quite large. There was a bit of dust here and there, but generally everything was kept clean. We were told that this unit was scheduled for renovation. We got a look at another unit which had already been renovated and appeared to have all new furniture and appliances, and was very nice. There was a brand new wooden sundeck on the roof and a small patio and pool in the courtyard. The location was great...two blocks from the French Quarter, a block from Harrah's and a short walk to the River. There were plenty of restaurants close by. However if you plan on cooking a lot, you'd have to go some distance to find a supermarket. There is no parking included, but public transportation is plentiful and cabs are not expensive. All in all, I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: LDianneFelix
Reviews.Content: I went to New Orleans for some rest and relaxation. I rented /exchanged through Interval International. I rented the two bedrooms and stayed a week even though It was just myself. I found the hotel in need of a lot of internal repair ie., carpets loose on the floors, wall air spaces (I could smell what the next room was cooking) because of the construction I guess from having done some repairs after the hurricane. The jacizzi tub didn't work, they said they would fix it but never did. What did it for me was, the day before I was to leave, I went to the roof patio to take the last few pictures in my camera of the skyscrapers. As I started down the stairs I fell flat on my face (right side). The wooden stairs were rotten and split horozonially (worn down) on the edges so when you step on them you lose your balance and fall forward. There were no railings to grab and no motion detector lights or lights. I fell on my face, my right knee and my right hand that I had just had surgery on 3 months before. I was bleeding from my knee and my hand and knee immediately swelled up. I went back to my room and called the front desk. I explained what happened and asked for help. I was told 1. no one was there to help me and the manager had gone home . I asked what should I do? I was told. 2. I don't know, then I was told 3. I could go to the hospital and the nearest hospital was in Meterie. I said It's 8:30pm and I'm injured, I'm from California, I don't know where Metairie is and I don't have a rental car. I was again told they didn't know what to do. I asked if they had a Policy telling them what to do if a resident had a medical emergency ie., a heart attack etc. or injury and I was told 4. they had no policy. The clerk asked if I wanted her to call the manager at home and I said yes. A few minutes later she called and said, " The manager said, If I was hurt to write down what happened and send them the bill." Frustrated, I called the advice nurse at Kaiser Hospital in California and was assessed for broken bones and was told to use ice packs then, advised to go to the Emergency room as soon as I got home which is what I did. Still swollen when I got home , they took X-rays of my knee and hand I didn't have to have another surgery on my hand. Now one year and 3 months later I learned that I also had a cracked rib on the right side. My knee now has a permanent scar to remind me of this horrible experience, the face swelling went down with ice. After I returned home I called to speak with the manager at least 5 times, I left 5 messages for the management staff to return my calls to discuss the matter and STILL to this day I have not received a call acknowledging the accident or any of my calls. I tried to access the bills associated with my treatment but my insurance is through the State of California and a third party such as an attorney could access the records but, not the patient. I contacted 12 different attorneys one in California and 11 in Louisiana to assist me with thes matter and was told by the 9 who did contact me that my "injuries were not severe enough for them to take on the case" So, I just gave up. I made a verbal and written complaint with the vacation exchange company Interval International and they assured me they would handle the matter, they would look into it. I don't believe they did because after several months of contacting them they kept telling me that "Corporate" would look into it and contact me and no one ever did. So, To stay at the Hotel de L'Eau Vive at 315 Tchoupitoulas St. New Orleans Louisiana is to "Take your life in your own hands." Stay at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Building Site”
Reviews.Author: UKViisitor9
Reviews.Content: The accommodation we were offered was not even one star - there may be 'new accommodation' but we were not offered it. We were shown 3 different apartments and they were all dirty. We had to stay one night because we arrived very late - but we checked out the next morning. The hotel was scruffy and dirty, from outside the building to reception through to the pool area to the apartments we were offered. I'm not convinced that the sheets on the bed were clean, certainly the top cover was stained. The dressing table top was 'sticky', the drawers were full of dust, the carpets were dusty and stained, the dining room chairs were all stained. There were no windows to the outside in the apartment. All in all, one of the worst experiences of all time.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION LOCATION ! A HIDDEN GEM IN THE CITY.”
Reviews.Author: JERSEYGROWN
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Hotel De L'Eau Vive while attending a convention at the Ernest Morial Convention Center. Having read previous reviews I was kind of nervous about my upcoming stay, however, I was extremely satisfied with my stay. The feel is like having your own private pied a tere in the center of a wonderful city of faboulous restaurants and wonderfull old world culture. The hotel although technically is a time share is a two building 3 story brownstone structure which is an historical landmark having once been part of a sugar plantation in the 1800's, a former bordello in the early 1900's and later transformed into a hotel/and timeshare property. Upon my arrival I was greated by the desk clerk in a small but comfortable lobby where soft jazz music was playing. I arrvived early in the morning and was able to leave my luggage at the hoelt while I explored the city. Check in is 4:00PM but my Room 301 was ready early and I checked in at 3:00PM. My two bedroom unit was immaculate. Again, this is a transformed historical building so if you are looking for a glitzy, traditional hotel/with restaurants then stay at the Sheraton or Marriott around the corner. What I liked about my stay was the size of the unit , which had a large living room, breakfast area, kitchen with microwave, full size stove, 3/4 size refrig with all cooking utensils, plates, dishwasher, blender, toaster, etc. I only used the kitchen to make breakfast because my intention was to to eat out for dinner and my days were at the convention center. My bedroom had an attractive antique wrought iron brass bed and the other bedroom had a similar queen size bed all with ample storage/dresser units. The ceilings are high with the original exposed brick and the windows are at least 6 feet high allowing sunlight and an airy feel. My unit faced the street, but surprisingly since it is a side street it was very quiet considering I was in the middle of the city. The shower was wonderfull with immediate hot water and excellent water pressure. After a long day on my feet at the convention center the shower was quite relaxing. I did not test the jacuzzi but it easily could fit two adults. My toilet sometimes made a funny sump/pump sound when flushed which only happened on an occassion and lasted a few minutes and must have had something to do with the age or renovation process. However, I never heard any sounds from the other units. This was a very quiet private building. There was daily maid service with fresh towels if you left them on the floor and the bed was made every day. I wasn't expecting this. The TV /DVD/VCR was fine with basic cable stations. The air conditioning was fine although in Nov the temp is in the high/low 60's/70's.There is a coin washer/dryer on the 4th floor, and the roof top deck was being renovated. There is an inner courtyard type small pool with wrought iron table and chairs, maybe more like a dipping pool but it did not look like the water was filtered so unless it is maintained differenly during the summer months I wouldn't have gotten in it. The location is key as you can walk to the French Quarter, walk to the convention center, walk to the Riverfront, Canal street is one block over, walk to Harrah's Casino if you are into gambling, and take a scenic ride on one of the street cars. There are also wonderfull restaurants within the same block. August Restaurant +++++one of the finest in New Orleans is at one corner and Mother's Restaurant is at the other corner all within the same block as the Hotel. I ate at Mother's twice which is traditional Creole comfort food. The people are lined up outside for lunch in three piece suits in this unpretensious famous restaurant. Try the Deep Fried Oyster/PoyBoy sandwich or Etoufee or Gumbo over rice. I don't think they have their own parking lot but there are two private lots in the same block. There is no long term parking on this street. Also what I liked about this hotel although technically a time share is that there was no hard core selling or person pestering you about taking a tour of the building. There was a flyer placed under my door letting me know that there were units/weeks available but leaving it up to me to make the first move if interested. The nice young lady at the front desk printed out my airline boarding passes for me over their internet site but there isn't any public internet use and I'm not sure if the units hook up to internet. My own Verizon wireless worked just fine from the unit on my laptop. New Orleans is a wonderfull city with a lot to offer and is makng a fast come back post-Hurricane Katrina at least in the City/French Quarter. This was a devastated city but the people are resilient and seem to be going out in a big way to welcome visitors back to their city. I look forward to staying at the Hotel De L'Eau Vive on my next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment - we checked out and went to Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: Sioweng
Reviews.Content: We recently selected this property through our timeshare....Interval ranked it as a five star property...it was hardly one. First of all, there is no parking.....you have to walk four blocks to a public parking area at $20/night. Access to the room was past the poor excuse for a pool that floods when it rains and you need to wade through it. The next challenge was up an extremely narrow spiral stair case that could barely accomodate getting the luggage up intact. The next was a room that was dirty, in disrepair, and disheveled with mismatched furniture. To top it off, there was an open jar of vaseline on the night stand....should I say expectations? The remote control for the TV did not work so they gave me the instruction book and told me to fix it myself....I refused and "politely" gave it back to them. Next was the event of the Bachelor party thrown by various members of the sheriff's department....loud music..lot's of drinking and shrieking by female voices and the hoots of the male participants..along with thick, smelly cigar smoke.....what was worse was the front desk clerk...a youn lady more consumed with TV than the welfare of her occupants...she refused to do anything about it....she was clearly sympathetic to their cause having enjoyed their fruitful food buffet for dinner. I was able to personally appeal to law officers but they informed me that New Orleans did not have any ordinances regarding noise, but they did turn downj the sub-woofer on the stereo so we did not have to continue experiencing the base pounding through our bedroom floor. The next day, a further complaint to the manager generated no action......we checked out and moved to the Wyndham Avenue on St Charles via a re-booking from Interval, the time share service. It was supposed to be a lower clase property, but we found it delightful by comparison. As for the Hotel de L'Eau Vive, I would never recommend it to anyone unless you truly are used to alternative living.

Reviews.Title: “What a hole on earth!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mmechas71
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our resort in Vegas to visit New Orleans this year. we were really dissapointed from the front staff til lhow the hotel is mantained. The hotel has a' pool' inthe coutyard which was disgusting and the whole week we were there they did not bother to clean or at least try to minimize the odor that water. the hotel is rated as 5 star on interval and it seems that was a rating given on he year 2000 when the hotel was in better sanitary conditions. The room had a small patio which was full of table top glass and old fake plants covered on dust !!! We will never go there to that hotel. Thanks God New Orleans is so amazing that not even the hotel changed my love for that city

Reviews.Title: “not a real hotel......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought I was going to a 4 star hotel. boy was I mislead!

Reviews.Title: “Big Easy aint all that”
Reviews.Author: tom b
Reviews.Content: well the weather was cold and wet for a few days. But overall not that much a factor leading to this average rating. The Hotel is a timeshare located in a great spot between the Warehouse district(great for eating and entertainment) The French Quarter(great for beer and walking around for tourist sites)The Riverwalk is a must so is the Natchez steamboat ride.The trolleys are close by and run often down to the Garden district which is what you make of it,Although at night it seems caution applies. Park your car better yet dont bring it because everything is a short walk or local transportation 1.25 exact change 5.00 day pass is excellent. The zoo and aquarium are okay but I am from NYC so it tough to match up against ours. the riverwalk mall is excellent to make your first stop and go all the way thru it because ,well just because. also it has maps brocures and places that are stomach friendly to eat at. The reason I say this is although I like spicey food they think if it says cajun or creole it has to be loaded with red cayenne pepper.after 2 days it gets old and my wife isnt a fan of spice.AND I mean everything has it on it.well almost.Bring money since nothing is cheap although we found the New Orleans prices reasonable for a tourist trap. The good points of the trip were many. The locals are very friendly,the food overall was good,it is easy to get around.there werent many vagrants and they werent obnoxius.Harrahs was right across the street but we didnt gamble that much.The myth of accents being so thich you have trouble is bebunked.crescent citycafe (which is near the cigar factory and THE Big Easy drink place dont miss either)obriens,mothers and one other place we ate were great.sorry I was drinking that night.There is an A+P supermarket located on royal and ST.Peters in the Quarter that is really good. bad points were food spicy ,crawfish are a local thing not for real seafood eaters ,Harrahs buffet stunk.Did i mention bring money.

Reviews.Title: “Rated this apartment hotel the very best”
Reviews.Author: Trav11
Reviews.Content: This small apartment hotel on the border of the French Quarter and the CBD is so comfortable and stylish, with every facility one could need. Staff were very helpful with directions, shopping information etc. Oldest hotel in this area with a colourful history. Convenient to all New Orleans has to offer, being a couple of blocks from the main street, buses, shops and the river and in a quiet area. Good security also. Rooms very elegantly decorated, kitchenette in living area with cooking utensils, microwave, huge stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher. Very comfy sofas, TVs in bedroom and living area. All suite hotel format.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de L'Eau Vive
HotelInfo.Address: 315 Tchoupitoulas Street, New Orleans, LA 70130
